17.name: In both plosives and fricatives
17.description: Voicing contrast in both plosives and fricatives

37.name: Laterals, but no /l/, no obstruent laterals
37.description: Laterals, but no /l/, no obstruent lateral

56.name: Initial
56.description: Initial: stress is on the first syllable

57.name: Second
57.description: Second: stress is on the second syllable

58.name: Third
58.description: Third: stress is on the third syllable

59.name: Antepenultimate
59.description: Antepenultimate: stress is on the antepenultimate (third from the right) syllable

60.name: Penultimate
60.description: Penultimate: stress is on the penultimate (second from the right) syllable

61.name: Ultimate
61.description: Ultimate: stress is on the ultimate (last) syllable

62.name: Left-edge: First or second
62.description: Left-edge: Stress is on the first or second syllable

63.name: Left-oriented: One of the first three
63.description: Left-oriented: The third syllable is involved

64.name: Right-edge: Ultimate or penultimate
64.description: Right-edge: Stress on ultimate or penultimate syllable

65.name: Right-oriented: One of the last three

66.name: Unbounded: Stress can be anywhere
66.description: Unbounded: Stress can be anywhere in the word

70.name: No weight
70.description: No weight, or weight factor unknown

71.name: Long vowel
71.description: Long vowel: long vowels are heavy for stress

72.name: Coda consonant
72.description: Coda consonant: closed syllables are heavy for stress

73.name: Long vowel or coda consonant
73.description: Long vowel + Coda: long vowels or closed syllables

74.name: Prominence
74.description: Prominence: other factors are heavy for stress

76.name: Combined
76.description: Combined: two of the above factors determine weight

77.name: Trochaic
77.description: Trochaic: left-hand syllable in the foot is strong

78.name: Iambic
78.description: Iambic: right-hand syllable in the foot is strong

79.name: Dual: both trochaic and iambic
79.description: Dual: system has both trochaic and iambic feet

138.name: No case marking
138.description: Inflectional case marking is absent or minimal

139.name: Core cases only
139.description: Inflectional case marking is syncretic for core cases only

140.name: Core and non-core
140.description: Inflectional case marking is syncretic for core and non-core cases

141.name: No syncretism
141.description: Inflectional case marking is never syncretic

144.name: Not syncretic
144.description: Subject person/number marking is never syncretic

166.name: Only human nouns, optional
166.description: Plural only in human nouns, optional

167.name: Only human nouns, obligatory
167.description: Plural only in human nouns, obligatory

168.name: All nouns, always optional
168.description: Plural in all nouns, always optional

169.name: All nouns, optional in inanimates
169.description: Plural in all nouns, optional in inanimates

170.name: All nouns, always obligatory
170.description: Plural in all nouns, always obligatory

175.name: Person-number stem + pronominal plural affix
175.description: Person-number stem with a pronominal plural affix

176.name: Person-number stem + nominal plural affix
176.description: Person-number stem with a nominal plural affix

177.name: Person stem + pronominal plural affix
177.description: Person stem with a pronominal plural affix

178.name: Person stem + nominal plural affix
178.description: Person stem with a nominal plural affix

179.name: Associative same as additive plural
179.description: Associative plural marker also used for additive plurals

191.name: No indefinite, but definite article
191.description: No indefinite article but definite article

211.name: Unrelated
211.description: Third person pronouns and demonstratives are unrelated to demonstratives

212.name: Related for all demonstratives
212.description: Third person pronouns and demonstratives are related to all demonstratives

213.name: Related to remote demonstratives
213.description: Third person pronouns and demonstratives are related to remote demonstratives

214.name: Related to non-remote demonstratives
214.description: Third person pronouns and demonstratives are related to non-remote demonstratives

215.name: Related by gender markers
215.description: Third person pronouns and demonstratives are related by gender markers

216.name: Related for non-human reference
216.description: Third person pronouns and demonstratives are related for non-human reference

217.name: In 3rd person + 1st and/or 2nd person
217.description: Gender distinctions in 3rd person plus 1st and/or 2nd person

219.name: 3rd person singular only
219.description: Gender distinctions in 3rd person singular only

220.name: 1st or 2nd person but not 3rd
220.description: Gender distinctions in 1st or 2nd person but not 3rd

221.name: 3rd person non-singular only
221.description: Gender distinctions in 3rd person non-singular only

223.name: No politeness distinction
223.description: Second person pronouns encode no politeness distinction

224.name: Binary politeness distinction
224.description: Second person pronouns encode a binary politeness distinction

225.name: Multiple politeness distinctions
225.description: Second person pronouns encode multiple politeness distinctions

226.name: Pronouns avoided for politeness
226.description: Second person pronouns are dominantly avoided for politeness reasons

233.name: Identical
233.description: Intensifiers and reflexive pronouns are formally identical

234.name: Differentiated
234.description: Intensifiers and reflexive pronouns are formally differentiated

238.name: Pronouns and nouns
238.description: Person marking for pronouns and nouns

257.name: Case stem change
257.description: Case coded by changes within noun stem

258.name: Mixed morphological case
258.description: Mixed morphological case strategies with none primary

266.description: Zero: Ordinal numerals do not exist

267.name: One, two, three
267.description: One: No distinction of cardinal and ordinal numerals

268.name: First, two, three
268.description: First: Cardinal and ordinal numerals are identical except for 'one' and 'first'

269.name: One-th, two-th, three-th
269.description: One-th: One-th: Ordinal numerals are derived from cardinal numerals

270.name: First/one-th, two-th, three-th
270.description: First/One-th: All ordinal numerals are derived from cardinal numerals with different allomorphs for 'first' one of which is morphologically independent of 'one'

271.name: First, two-th, three-th
271.description: Two-th: Two-th: Ordinal numerals from 'two' upwards are derived from cardinal numerals, 'first' is suppletive

272.name: First, second, three-th
272.description: Second: 'First' and a small set of consecutive higher ordinal numerals are suppletive

280.name: Marked by mixed or other strategies
280.description: Marked by mixed or other strategies

285.name: Formally similar, without interrogative
285.description: Formally similar, not involving interrogative expression

298.name: Genitives and adjectives collapsed
298.description: Moderately differentiated, with genitives and adjectives collapsed

299.name: Genitives and relative clauses collapsed
299.description: Moderately differentiated, with genitives and relative clauses collapsed

300.name: Adjectives and relative clauses collapsed
300.description: Moderately differentiated, with adjectives and relative clauses collapsed

303.name: Not without noun
303.description: Adjective may not occur without noun

304.name: Without marking
304.description: Adjective may occur without noun, and without marking

305.name: Marked by prefix
305.description: Adjective may occur without noun, obligatorily marked by prefix

306.name: Marked by suffix
306.description: Adjective may occur without noun, obligatorily marked by suffix

307.name: Marked by preceding word
307.description: Adjective may occur without noun, obligatorily marked by preceding word

308.name: Marked by following word
308.description: Adjective may occur without noun, obligatorily marked by following word

309.name: Marked by mixed or other strategies
309.description: Adjective may occur without noun, obligatorily marked by mixed or other strategies

310.name: Sentential
310.description: Sentential: dependent-marking of the finite clause is retained for S, A and P

311.name: Possessive-Accusative
311.description: Possessive-Accusative: S/A treated as possessors, P retains sentential marking

312.name: Ergative-Possessive
312.description: Ergative-Possessive: S/P treated as possessors, A treated differently

313.name: Double-Possessive
313.description: Double-Possessive: All major arguments treated as possessors

315.name: Mixed
315.description: Mixed: Several patterns in the same language

316.name: Restricted
316.description: Not both A and P in the same construction

320.name: Identity
320.description: Nominal and verbal conjunction are largely identical

321.name: Differentiation
321.description: Nominal and verbal conjunction are different

322.name: Both expressed by juxtaposition
322.description: Nominal and verbal conjunction are primarily expressed by juxtaposition

324.name: No grammatical marking
324.description: No grammatical marking of perfective/imperfective distinction

325.name: Present, no remoteness distinctions
325.description: Past/non-past distinction marked; no remoteness distinction

326.name: Present, 2-3 remoteness distinctions
326.description: Past/non-past distinction marked; 2-3 degrees of remoteness distinguished

327.name: Present, 4 or more remoteness distinctions
327.description: Past/non-past distinction marked; at least 4 degrees of remoteness distinguished

328.name: No past tense
328.description: No grammatical marking of past/non-past distinction

330.name: No inflectional future
330.description: No inflectional marking of future/non-future distinction

331.name: From possessive
331.description: Perfect of the 'have'-type (derived from a possessive construction)

332.name: From 'finish', 'already'
332.description: Perfect derived from word meaning 'finish' or 'already'

340.name: Second singular and second plural
340.description: The language has morphologically dedicated second singular as well as second plural imperatives

342.name: Second plural
342.description: The language has morphologically dedicated second plural imperatives but no morphologically dedicated second singular imperatives

343.name: Second person number-neutral
343.description: The language has morphologically dedicated second person imperatives that do not distinguish between singular and plural

344.name: No second-person imperatives
344.description: The language has no morphologically dedicated second-person imperatives at all

345.name: Normal imperative + normal negative
345.description: The prohibitive uses the verbal construction of the second singular imperative and a sentential negative strategy found in (indicative) declaratives

341.name: Second singular
341.description: The language has morphologically dedicated second singular imperatives but no morphologically dedicated second plural imperatives

347.name: Special imperative + normal negative
347.description: The prohibitive uses a verbal construction other than the second singular imperative and a sentential negative strategy found in (indicative) declaratives

348.name: Special imperative + special negative
348.description: The prohibitive uses a verbal construction other than the second singular imperative and a sentential negative strategy not found in (indicative) declaratives

350.name: Minimal system
350.description: The language has a minimal system, but not a maximal one

351.name: Both types of system
351.description: The language has both a maximal and a minimal system

352.name: Neither type of system
352.description: The language has neither a maximal nor a minimal system

356.name: Verbal constructions
356.description: The language cannot express situational possibility with affixes on verbs, but with verbal constructions

357.name: Other kinds of markers
357.description: The language cannot express situational possibility with affixes on verbs or with verbal constructions, but with other kinds of markers

358.name: Verbal constructions
358.description: The language can express epistemic possibility with verbal constructions

361.name: Other
361.description: The language cannot express epistemic possibility with verbal constructions or with affixes on verbs, but with other kinds of markers

362.name: Overlap for both possibility and necessity
362.description: The language has markers that can code both situational and epistemic modality, both for possibility and necessity

364.name: No overlap
364.description: The language has no markers that can code both situational and epistemic modality

376.name: Tense and aspect
376.description: Suppletion in both tense and aspect

377.description: No suppletion in tense or aspect

349.name: Maximal system
349.description: The language has a maximal system, but not a minimal one

355.name: Affixes on verbs
355.description: The language can express situational possibility with affixes on verbs

360.name: Affixes on verbs
360.description: The language cannot express epistemic possibility with verbal constructions, but with affixes on verbs

363.name: Overlap for either possibility or necessity
363.description: The language has markers that can code both situational and epistemic modality, but only for possibility or for necessity

427.name: No dominant order
427.description: Both orders occur with neither order dominant

442.name: Mixed
442.description: More than one type of adverbial subordinators with none dominant

478.name: Subject affixes on verb
478.description: Pronominal subjects are expressed by affixes on verbs

481.name: Optional pronouns in subject position
481.description: Pronominal subjects are expressed only by pronouns in subject position, but these pronouns are often left out

482.name: Mixed
482.description: More than one of the above types with none dominant

483.name: No person marking
483.description: No person marking of any argument

484.name: Only the A argument
484.description: Person marking of only the A argument

485.name: Only the P argument
485.description: Person marking of only the P argument

486.name: A or P argument
486.description: Person marking of the A or P argument

488.name: No person marking
488.description: No person marking of the S

477.name: Obligatory pronouns in subject position
477.description: Pronominal subjects are expressed by pronouns in subject position that are normally if not obligatorily present

487.name: Both the A and P arguments
487.description: Person marking of both the A and P arguments

489.name: No zero realization
489.description: No zero realization of third person S forms

490.name: Zero in some 3sg forms
490.description: Zero realization of some third person singular forms

491.name: Zero in all 3sg forms
491.description: Zero realization of all third person singular S forms

492.name: Zero in all 3rd person forms
492.description: Zero realization of all third person forms/No third person S forms

493.name: Zero only in 3rd nonsingular
493.description: Zero realization only of third person non-singular

494.name: A and P do not or do not both occur on the verb
494.description: A and P do not or do not both occur on the verb

497.name: Both orders of A and P occur
497.description: Both orders of A and P occur

503.name: No reciprocals
503.description: There are no non-iconic reciprocal constructions.

504.name: Distinct from reflexive
504.description: All reciprocal constructions are formally distinct from reflexive constructions.

505.name: Mixed
505.description: There are both reflexive and non-reflexive reciprocal constructions.

506.name: Identical to reflexive
506.description: The reciprocal and reflexive constructions are formally identical.

509.name: Implicit patient
509.description: Antipassive with patient-like argument left implicit

510.name: Oblique patient
510.description: Antipassive with patient-like argument expressed as oblique complement

513.name: Benefactive object; only transitive
513.description: Benefactive object only; transitive base only

515.name: Benefactive and other; only transitive
515.description: Benefactive and other; transitive base only

517.name: Non-benefactive object; only transitive
517.description: Non-benefactive object only; transitive base only

518.name: Non-benefactive object; only intransitive
518.description: Non-benefactive object only; intransitive base only

520.name: Sequential but no purposive
520.description: Sequential type but no purposive type

521.name: Purposive but no sequential
521.description: Purposive type but no sequential type

522.name: Both
522.description: Both sequential type and purposive type

523.name: Neither
523.description: No morphological type or compound type

524.name: Morphological but no compound
524.description: Morphological type but no compound type

525.name: Compound but no morphological
525.description: Compound type but no morphological type

526.name: Both
526.description: Both morphological type and compound type

533.name: Symmetric
533.description: Symmetric standard negation only: Type Sym

534.name: Asymmetric
534.description: Asymmetric standard negation only: Type Asy

535.name: Both
535.description: Symmetric and asymmetric standard negation: Type SymAsy

538.name: A/Cat
538.description: In other grammatical categories: Subtype A/Cat

539.name: A/Fin and A/NonReal
539.description: In finiteness and reality status: Subtypes A/Fin and A/NonReal

540.name: A/Fin and A/Cat
540.description: In finiteness and other grammatical categories: Subtypes A/Fin and A/Cat

541.name: A/NonReal and A/Cat
541.description: In reality status and other grammatical categories: Subtypes A/NonReal and A/Cat

543.name: Predicate negation also present
543.description: Negative indefinites co-occur with predicate negation

562.name: Different
562.description: Split (i.e. different) encoding of nominal and locational predication

563.name: Identical
563.description: Shared (i.e. identical) encoding of nominal and locational predication

576.name: Subject is left implicit
576.description: The complement subject is left implicit

577.name: Subject is expressed overtly
577.description: The complement subject is expressed overtly

579.name: Desiderative verbal affix
579.description: 'Want' is expressed as a desiderative verbal affix

580.name: Desiderative particle
580.description: 'Want' is expressed as an uninflected desiderative particle

593.name: Identical
593.description: Identity: a single word denotes both 'hand' and 'arm'

594.name: Different
594.description: Differentiation: one word denotes 'hand' and another, different word denotes 'arm'

595.name: Identical
595.description: Identity: a single word denotes both 'hand' and 'finger' and/or 'fingers'

596.name: Different
596.description: Differentiation: one word denotes 'hand' and another, different word denotes 'finger' (or, very rarely, 'fingers')

611.description: Between 4 and 5, 5, or between 5 and 6 categories

623.description: Green and blue not both encoded in any basic color term

628.description: Red and yellow not both encoded in any basic color term

645.name: Logical meanings
645.description: Clicks may express logical meanings ('yes' and/or 'no')

646.name: Affective meanings
646.description: Clicks may express affective but not logical meanings

647.name: Other or none
647.description: Clicks may express neither affective nor logical meanings

652.name: Demonstrative before and after Noun
652.description: Demonstrative simultaneously before and after noun

662.name: VNeg&[V-Neg]
662.description: Both postverbal negative word and negative suffix

685.name: OptDoubleNeg
685.description: Separate word, optional double negation, with NegSOV possible without a second negative

686.name: OnlyWithAnotherNeg
686.description: Separate word, only occurs with another negative morpheme

687.name: No NegSOV
687.description: SOV but NegSOV does not occur

690.name: Word&OptDoubleNeg
690.description: Separate word, optional double negation, with SVNegO possible without a second negative

691.name: Suffix&OptDoubleNeg
691.description: Suffix, optional double negation, with SVNegO possible without a second negative

692.name: Word&OnlyWithAnotherNeg
692.description: Separate word, only occurs with another negative morpheme

693.name: Suffix&OnlyWithAnotherNeg
693.description: Suffix, only occurs with another negative morpheme

696.name: SVO but NegSNegOV
696.description: NegSNegOV but SVO in affirmative clauses

694.name: No SVNegO
694.description: SVO, but SVNegO does not occur

703.name: SVO but SONeg[V-Neg]/SO[Neg-V-Neg]
703.description: SONeg[V-Neg]/SO[Neg-V-Neg] but SVO in affirmative clauses

705.name: SO[V-Neg]Neg & OptNegPref/Infix
705.description: SO[V-Neg]Neg with optional negative prefix or infix

707.name: SNegOVNeg/SVONeg&NegTone
707.description: SNegOVNeg or SVONeg with negative tone on verb

715.name: Word&OptDoubleNeg
715.description: Separate word, optional double negation, with SONegV possible without a second negative

716.name: Suffix&OptDoubleNeg
716.description: Suffix, optional double negation, with SONegV possible without a second negative

717.name: Word&OnlyWithAnotherNeg
717.description: Separate word, only occurs with another negative morpheme

718.name: Suffix&OnlyWithAnotherNeg
718.description: Suffix, only occurs with another negative morpheme

723.name: NoSOVNeg
723.description: SOV, but SOVNeg does not occur

725.name: OptDoubleNeg
725.description: Separate word, optional double negation, with clause-final negative word possible without a second negative

726.name: OnlyWithAnotherNeg
726.description: Separate word, only occurs with another negative morpheme

727.name: No clause-final neg
727.description: Verb-initial but clause-final negative does not occur

743.name: More than one position
743.description: More than one position for negative morpheme, with none dominant

747.name: MorphNeg
747.description: Morphological negation only (but not double negation)

762.name: Word&Opt
762.description: Separate word, optional single or double negation, with preverbal negative word possible without a second negative

763.name: Prefix&OptDoubleNeg
763.description: Prefix, optional double negation, with negative prefix possible without a second negative

764.name: Word&OnlyWithAnotherNeg
764.description: Separate word, only occurs with another negative morpheme

765.name: Prefix&OnlyWithAnotherNeg
765.description: Prefix, only occurs with another negative morpheme

768.name: No preverbal neg
768.description: Verb-initial but preverbal negative does not occur

771.name: Word&OptDoubleNeg
771.description: Separate word, optional double negation, with SNegVO possible without a second negative

772.name: Prefix&OptDoubleNeg
772.description: Prefix, optional double negation, with SNegVO possible without a second negative

773.name: Word&OnlyWithAnotherNeg
773.description: Separate word, only occurs with another negative morpheme

774.name: Prefix&OnlyWithAnotherNeg
774.description: Prefix, only occurs with another negative morpheme

779.name: Word&OptDoubleNeg
779.description: Separate word, optional double negation, with SONegV possible without a second negative

780.name: Prefix&OptDoubleNeg
780.description: Prefix, optional double negation, with SONegV possible without a second negative

781.name: Word&OnlyWithAnotherNeg
781.description: Separate word, only occurs with another negative morpheme

782.name: Prefix&OnlyWithAnotherNeg
782.description: Prefix, only occurs with another negative morpheme

784.name: No SONegV
784.description: SOV, but SONegV does not occur

800.name: ObligDoubleNeg&OptTripleNeg
800.description: Obligatory double negation with optional triple negation

804.name: NegSOV/2ndPos
804.description: NegSOV or SOV with second position negative word

807.name: SO[Neg-V]/SOVwithNegInfix
807.description: SO[Neg-V] or SOV with negative infix

853.name: SNegVO/SVNegO&NegTone
853.description: SNegVO or SVNegO with tone on verb

863.name: OptDoubleNeg
863.description: Separate word, optional double negation, with SVONeg possible without a second negative

864.name: OnlyWithAnotherNeg
864.description: Separate word, only occurs with another negative morpheme

865.name: No SVONeg
865.description: SVO but SVONeg does not occur

866.name: Beginning, not immed preverbal
866.description: At beginning of clause separated from verb

867.name: Preverbal, not beginning or immed
867.description: Preceding verb, separated from verb, but not at beginning of clause

870.name: Postverbal, not immed or end
870.description: Following verb, separated from verb, but not at end of clause

875.name: SVO/VSO but NegSVONeg
875.description: SVO/VSO in affirmative clauses but NegSVONeg

881.name: SVNegO&NegTone
881.description: SVNegO with negative tone on verb

882.name: S[Neg-V]O&NegTone
882.description: S[Neg-V]O with negative tone on verb

886.name: (Neg)S(Neg)VONeg
886.description: (Neg)S(Neg)VONeg (at least one of the preverbal Negs)

887.name: SNeg[V-Neg]O&NegTone/SNegVNegO
887.description: SNeg[V-Neg]O and negative tone on verb / SNegVNegO

891.name: SVONeg&NegTone/SNegOVNeg
891.description: SVONeg with negative tone on verb / SNegOVNeg

937.name: VSO but NegSVO
937.description: VSO in affirmative clauses, but NegSVO

938.name: SVO/SOV but SVONeg
938.description: SVO/SOV in affirmative clauses, but SVONeg

939.name: SOV/SOV but SNegVO
939.description: SVO/SOV in affirmative clauses, but SNegVO

940.name: Other NegV
940.description: Other SVO with preverbal negative word

941.name: Other VNeg
941.description: Other SVO with postverbal negative word

952.name: NegV&[Neg-V]
952.description: Both preverbal negative word and negative prefix

966.name: NegV&OptChangeVerbStem
966.description: NegV plus optional change to verb stem

976.name: OptDoubleNeg&OptTripleNeg
976.description: Optional double negation with optional triple negation

994.name: OptTripleNeg&ObligDoubleNeg
994.description: Optional Triple Negation with Obligatory Double Negation

995.name: OptTripleNeg&OptDoubleNeg
995.description: Optional Triple Negation with Optional Double Negation

997.name: Word&OnlyWithAnotherNeg
997.description: Separate word, immediately following verb, only occurs with another negative morpheme

998.name: Suffix&OptDoubleNeg
998.description: Suffix, optional double negation, can occur without a second negative

999.name: Suffix&OnlyWithAnotherNeg
999.description: Suffix, only occurs with another negative morpheme

1000.name: WordBetweenSAndO
1000.description: Separate word, between subject and object

1001.description: Verb-initial but immediately postverbal negative or negative between subject and object does not occur

1012.name: SOV but S[Neg-V-Neg]O/SO[V-Neg]
1012.description: S[Neg-V-Neg]O/SO[V-Neg] but SOV in affirmative clauses

1024.name: OptDoubleNeg
1024.description: Separate word, optional double negation, with SNegOV possible without a second negative

1025.name: OnlyWithAnotherNeg
1025.description: Separate word, only occurs with another negative morpheme

1026.name: No SNegOV
1026.description: SOV but SNegOV does not occur

1033.name: SVO but SNegOV
1033.description: SNegOV but SVO in affirmative clauses

1034.name: SVO but SONegV
1034.description: SONegV but SVO in affirmative clauses

1035.name: SVO but SOVNeg
1035.description: SOVNeg but SVO in affirmative clauses

1036.name: SVO but SO[V-Neg]
1036.description: SO[V-Neg] but SVO in affirmative clauses

1037.name: SVO but SO[Neg-V]
1037.description: SO[Neg-V] but SVO in affirmative clauses

1038.name: SVO/SOV but SNegOV
1038.description: SNegOV but SVO/SOV in affirmative clauses

1039.name: SVO/SOV but SOVNeg
1039.description: SOVNeg but SVO/SOV in affirmative clauses

1040.name: Other NegV
1040.description: Other SOV with preverbal negative word

1048.name: SV&OV&ImmedPreverbal
1048.description: SV & OV with immediately preverbal negative word

1049.name: SV&OV&InitialNeg
1049.description: SV & OV with clause-initial negative word

1051.name: OptDoubleNeg
1051.description: Separate word, optional double negation, with NegSVO possible without a second negative

1052.name: OnlyWithAnotherNeg
1052.description: Separate word, only occurs with another negative morpheme

1077.name: SVO but NegVSO
1077.description: NegVSO but SVO in affirmative clauses

1099.name: [V-Neg]Neg&OptNegInfix or Pref
1099.description: [V-Neg]Neg with optional negative infix or prefix

1101.name: Neg[V-Neg]/NegVNeg&NegTone
1101.description: (i) Neg[V-Neg] or (ii) NegVNeg with negative tone

1106.name: No m in second person singular
1106.description: No m in second person singular

1108.name: No m in first person singular
1108.description: No m in first person singular

1115.name: no nasal vs. oral vowel contrast
1115.description: no nasal vs. oral vowel contrast

1116.name: two-way nasal vs. oral vowel contrast (/ṽ/ vs. /V/) with nasal spreading
